Pawn.definition: a pledge and transfer of possession of movable or personal property to a creditor which gives the creditor the privilege of satisfying the debt from the property
Pawn.origin: [shall not take as a any workman's tools]

1 a.definition: a pledge and transfer of possession of movable or personal property to a creditor which gives the creditor the privilege of satisfying the debt from the property (as by selling it) if the debt is not repaid within a specified timethe property pledged [shall not take as a any workman's tools] compare

sub_terms.b: the state of being so pledged or burdened by such a pledge [goods held in ]

2.definition: the act of pawningvtto put (personal or movable property) in pawn [when it is redeemed by the person whoit] compare
